Posts.Content: Thanks Londongurl. Will look out for that one x
Posts.Title: Shampoo

Posts.Content: Hi Its been 9 months since my last chemo. I have been using coconut shampoo throughout as instructed. Before cancer I used Neutrogena T/Gel most of the time as I suffered from a flaky scalp. Now every time I touch my hair, it snows lol (lots of dandruff) Is it safe to use the T/Gel again? Thanks  Joanne x
Posts.Title: Shampoo

Posts.Content: Thanks Toxophilite but unfortunately I've tried head and shoulders before with no effect. Before T-Gel I used polytar before it was discontinued. Horrible smell anyway x
Posts.Title: Shampoo

Posts.Content: Thank you Leolady56. I will ask a nurse. Not been easy these past 9 months. Always tired but the good news is my first mammogram after treatment was clear xx
Posts.Title: Shampoo

Posts.Content: Hi I have also had my first mammogram (13 days ago)after my treatment. Don't really know the answer to your question but wouldn't think there would be many as we're not long after treatment. Saying that I was terrified and told my surgeon. I even had pains in my breast and shoulder blade. The surgeon had a feel and said he wasn't worried. Then I had to suffer the mammogram. So I think because I was so worried and  tense I was causing the pain. I am sure we will be both ok, just maybe find ways to relax although it's easier said than done. Take Care. Jo x
Posts.Title: 1st mammogram after Wle, chemo and radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Thanks Stars for your support. I keep thinking that this time in two weeks time I will be a bit better and the radiotherapy is not going to be half as bad.I didn't feel like this on the first three. In fact I took a blood retest on the day after on one just so there wouldn't be a delay. Maybe if I was supported a bit from family and friends it would help:(  Jo x
Posts.Title: Scared to last Chemo

Posts.Content: I'm in a dilemma. I'm on the FEC-T treatment and had 5 treatments already. The fourth one was terrible with alot of pain but the 5th one was even worse. I have hardly been out. It's either pain, diarrhoea or constipation as well as mouth ulcers. I don't get on during the steroids either and can't eat during that time. Also felt dizzy at the top of the stairs. I felt very vulnerable. Doesn't help that I am totally on my own. I'm HER2 positive and only had a tiny lump in my breast. Do I go through with the 6th treatment on Thursday and put myself in danger or should I go straight onto the radiotherapy? I'm also on herceptin. Jo
Posts.Title: Scared to last Chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks Kacang and Bryony. I'm taking 16mg of dexamethasone the day before, 8 on the day as the hospital give me steroids through the drip and another day of steroids the day after. I take them at 8 am and 3 pm. Haven't had an accident yet but I had to rush home from Asda and only just made the toilet. During that time as soon as I eat I get stomach pains and I'm on the toilet within the hour. I'll be glad when all this is over. Jo x
Posts.Title: Scared to last Chemo

Posts.Content: Already reduced the chemo to the max. It's the chemo I'm on or nothing. As for the steroids they won't reduce them either. In fact I'm on more now than the FEC. I have a planning session a week after the chemo for the radiotherapy. Going by my last 2 sessions I was on the toilet on day 7 so don't know how I'm going to manage going out x
Posts.Title: Scared to last Chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks for your advice Bryony. I have my blood test tomorrow so I will see what they say at the hospital. One thing is for certain is that I need to be fit for my radiotherapy planning session 7 days after my chemo which involves a train and a bit of a walk. I will keep you informed what happens and plan to stay on this friendly forum. Jo x
Posts.Title: Scared to last Chemo

Posts.Content: Well I've been to get my bloods taken and explained it all to the chemo nurse. My chemo isn't on Thursday now although I will have the herceptin that day. The Oncologist is going to have a chat with me then. It will be a case of knock it all on the head chemo wise or a weeks break. The nurse did say that the letrozole and the herceptin were the most important parts which make me wonder what all the pain and the loss of hair was for?? As for the getting friends to take me to radiotherapy Bryony, I have been let down by my friends at work apart from one. It's been a long and lonely journey for me. Jo x
Posts.Title: Scared to last Chemo

Posts.Content: Well I went to see the Oncologist yesterday. She said straight away I have done more than enough with the 5 chemos. Am so relieved. Even the nurses when my herceptin was being given said the right thing has been done. I am still very tired and my stomach is still sore but I can try and get some strength back ready for my radiotherapy on the 20th. Started the letrozole last night. Thanks for all your replies. Jo x
Posts.Title: Scared to last Chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks Toxophilite. Not tried the clarityn. My oncologist did mention even more steroids but I don't get on with them with sleepness nights and restlessness. No one has mentioned that I have to finish the T  for herceptin. I think I need to speak to someone before my blood test as I'm not sleeping due to worry x
Posts.Title: Scared to last Chemo

Posts.Content: Thanks for your reply Cartwheels. I'm already on cocodamal for the pain and medication for diarrhoea and constipation. The chemo has been reduced by 20% already. Alot of the pain is coming from the injections to boost the white cells but I'm not allowed to stop them. So I take painkillers, this causes constipation and then the diarrhoea starts. It's just a vicious circle:( xx
Posts.Title: Scared to last Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi This is a fantastic thread. It's given me a kick up the behind to go out walking. Just back from about a mile walk. My cheeks are red and joints ache but will keep doing it daily. I will post pictures when I'm on a more scenic route. Keep Walking Jo x
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi All I think my poor wee nose is going to have to get amputated. I've been on herceptin since May and my last dose of chemo was June. I wouldn't mind but I'm back at work now and it's embarrassing. Only had my injection on Wednesday and it's caking up overnight. Now bleeding quite bad even onto the bridge of my nose. Tried naseptin and vaseline. I think it's a brown paper bag over my head tomorrow for work. Jo x
Posts.Title: Nose sores!!
